definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Taught that death in the battlefield is the greatest glory he could achieve in his life.
sentences.chinese: 我們只知道戰死沙場是一生中最大的榮譽。

sentences.english: I don't know who wants to be the last person to die for Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 我現在還不知道誰不願意爲阿富汗去戰死沙場的。

sentences.english: How some have been deposed, some slain in war.
sentences.chinese: 有些被廢黜，有些戰死沙場。

sentences.english: Our soldiers shouldn't die for it.
sentences.chinese: 我們的士兵不應該爲這樣一件事戰死沙場。

sentences.english: Even we die in the war, our heart and mind will go on.
sentences.chinese: 即使戰死沙場，我們的心與精神永不磨滅。

sentences.english: Come back with your shield…or on it.
sentences.chinese: 帶着你的盾牌回來，不然就戰死沙場。

sentences.english: You may die on the battlefield when fighting the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 出陣迎敵就有戰死沙場的危險。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
